title: Scotland 1-3 England: Gareth Southgate condemns 'ridiculous' criticism of Harry Maguire
description: England boss Gareth Southgate condemns the "ridiculous treatment" of Harry Maguire, saying the criticism the defender has faced is "a joke".

title: Scotland 1-3 England: 'Complete package' Jude Bellingham puts concluding flourish on world-class performance
description: Jude Bellingham's vision and touch put the concluding flourish on a world-class performance as England cruised past Scotland, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

title: Chris Mason: The big questions on the future of the triple lock
description: BBC Political Editor Chris Mason looks at the politics and perils of rising state pensions.

title: Euro 2024: Scotland still waiting for qualification after Norway beat Georgia
description: Scotland will have to wait until next month at the earliest to confirm their Euro 2024 qualification after Norway beat Georgia 2-1 in Oslo.

title: Nitrous oxide: MPs approve bill to ban laughing gas possession
description: Under the law change possessing the drug would carry a sentence of up to two years in prison or a large fine.

title: Google antitrust trial: Tech giant denies abusing power to gain monopoly
description: In a landmark trial brought by the US government, the tech giant denies using illegal practices to gain a monopoly.

title: How dangerous is vaping - and why the concern over young vapers?
description: Calls are growing for a ban on cheaper disposable vapes as it becomes more popular with youngsters.

title: Scotland vs England: Rate the players from the international friendly at Hampden Park
description: Rate the players as Steve Clarke's Scotland take on Gareth Southgate's England in an international friendly at Hampden Park

title: BP boss resigns amid review of 'personal relationships'
description: The oil giant had recently renewed a probe of Bernard Looney's relationships with colleagues.

title: Labour set to vote against scrapping home building pollution rules
description: The party is preparing to vote against the government plan aimed at boosting housebuilding.

title: Three reasons Kim Jong Un and Vladimir Putin might want to be friends
description: From shared enemies to a reliance on China, Russia and North Korea have a few things in common.

title: Triple lock: State pension could go up less than expected next year
description: The government is not saying which figure will be used to calculate a rise under the triple lock.

title: Aaron Rodgers: Quarterback out for whole NFL season with torn Achilles
description: Aaron Rodgers will miss the rest of the NFL season as tests confirm the quarterback has a torn Achilles tendon.

title: House of Representatives to open Biden impeachment inquiry, Kevin McCarthy says
description: Senior Republican Kevin McCarthy says the inquiry will investigate allegations of abuse of power.

title: England v Sri Lanka: Rain denies home side chance of ODI series win in Northampton
description: England are thwarted by rain in their attempt to clinch the series as the second ODI against Sri Lanka is abandoned.

title: Tom Curry: England back row to miss two games after Rugby World Cup red card
description: Tom Curry will miss England's next two Rugby World Cup games after his red card in the win over Argentina.

title: Rugby World Cup: George Ford & Owen Farrell selection dilemma 'really nice problem' for England
description: Working out how best to deploy George Ford and Owen Farrell is a "really nice problem to have", says England attack coach Richard Wigglesworth.

title: Coronation arrests: Republic leader suing Met Police
description: The head of anti-monarchy campaign group Republic was detained at a pre-arranged Coronation protest.

title: Simona Halep banned for four years for doping offences
description: Two-time Grand Slam champion Simona Halep is banned four years following breaches of tennis doping rules.

title: England v Sri Lanka: Kulasuriya run out by Cross for 0
description: Kate Cross shows great awareness to run out Achini Kulasuriya after the Sri Lankan is caught meandering back to her crease at the non-striker's end.

title: Kim Jong Un crosses Russian border for talks with Putin
description: The two leaders could meet at the Vostochny space centre in Russia's far east, according to reports.

title: Jofra Archer trains with England on comeback from injury
description: Fast bowler Jofra Archer trains with England, raising hopes he could still travel to the World Cup as a reserve to the frontline squad.

title: Poundland owner to take on up to 71 Wilko stores
description: Pepco Group, which owns Poundland in the UK, will take control of dozens of Wilko store leases.

title: The Christie: NHS bosses targeted me for raising concerns, nurse says
description: She says she repeatedly asked bosses to examine patient safety concerns at Manchester's The Christie.

title: Watch: Bullock trapped in sinkhole hoisted to safety
description: Watch the moment a bullock is hoisted to safety by its legs after getting trapped in a sinkhole.

title: France v Uruguay: Rugby World Cup hosts make 12 changes for Pool A game
description: Anthony Jelonch will captain a much-changed France team that will take on Uruguay at the Rugby World Cup on Thursday.

title: Woman who died in Turkish buttock surgery not told of risks, says coroner
description: A coroner says Melissa Kerr should have been made aware of the dangers of the Turkish operation.

title: Luis Rubiales: Former Spanish FA president to appear in court over Jenni Hermoso kiss
description: Former Spanish Football Federation president Luis Rubiales is summoned to appear in high court on Friday over his kiss of Spain's Jenni Hermoso.

title: Angela Rayner stalls on triple lock pensions commitment
description: Labour's deputy leader echoes Rishi Sunak in refusing to commit to the policy at the next election.

title: England v Sri Lanka: Dean removes dangerous Athapaththu on 34

title: Incompatible charger 'turned scooter into a bomb'
description: Aerial pictures show the aftermath of a fire, caused by an e-scooter, that gutted a family home.

title: French woman shot through wall in Marseille drug shooting dies
description: The 24-year-old was shot in her bedroom after an attack aimed at a drug-dealing hotspot in Marseille.

title: Norton Fitzwarren man admits driving truck at police vehicles
description: Geoff Marshall has pleaded guilty to assault and multiple charges of criminal damage.

title: Tantalising sign of possible life on faraway world
description: Nasa's James Webb Telescope may have discovered a molecule thought only to be produced by life.

title: Dozens of crocodiles in China escape during floods

title: US releases $6bn in frozen Iran funds for prisoner swap
description: The US allows banks to move $6bn from South Korea, paving the way for the release of five Americans.

title: MGM Resorts: Slot machines go down in cyber-attack on firm

title: Colombia cocaine: Cultivation reaches record high
description: A UN report finds the area planted with coca bushes is the biggest ever registered.

title: Stolen Van Gogh handed to Dutch art sleuth in Ikea bag

title: Slug & Lettuce and Yates's owner to charge more at peak hours
description: Stonegate, which owns Slug & Lettuce and Yates's bars, will add about 20p to a pint during busy periods.

title: Morocco earthquake: One community's search for its last victim
description: No one has any hope of finding Fatima alive, but they say it is important her body is recovered.

title: Oscars: ITV to broadcast film awards after Sky drops coverage
description: Next year's ceremony on 10 March will be shown in the UK on ITV1 and streaming service ITVX.

title: Why is sewage pumped into rivers and the sea?
description: What is being done about raw sewage discharges into rivers and the sea?

title: Putin and Kim: Friends in need (of ammunition)
description: Russia needs weapons. N Korea has weapons. It's a match made in the geo-political realities of 2023.

title: Bed bugs at retirement complex force pensioner to sleep in car
description: An infestation in the 83-year-old's house has driven him to his car overnight to get some sleep.

title: Everton takeover news: Farhad Moshiri on verge of sale to 777 Partners
description: Premier League strugglers Everton are close to being sold by Farhad Moshiri to 777 Partners, BBC Sport understands.

title: Libyan floods: Derna city alone recovers 1,000 bodies - minister
description: Much of Derna is under water after two dams and four bridges collapsed in flooding after Storm Daniel.

title: Shoplifting an epidemic, says John Lewis boss
description: Dame Sharon White tells the BBC that shop workers are having to put up with abuse and attacks.

title: NFL: New York Jets rookie Xavier Gipson stuns Buffalo Bills with overtime game-winning touchdown
description: Watch New York Jets' undrafted rookie Xavier Gipson stun the Buffalo Bills, scoring a 65-yard punt return touchdown on his NFL debut in a 22-16 overtime win.

title: Government may have broken law over sewage - watchdog
description: The UK's independent watchdog has been investigating Defra and the EA for failure to meet environmental law.

title: Triple lock means state pension set to rise by 8.5% in April
description: It will be the second significant rise in the state pension in two years, but could pull more into paying tax.

title: Aerosmith postpone six farewell tour shows due to Steven Tyler's vocal cord damage
description: Singer Steven Tyler says he is "heartbroken" to push back six shows after "doctor's orders".

title: Glasgow drug consumption room could be approved in weeks
description: Scotland's drugs minister says new prosecution rules are a "significant" step in efforts to cut drug deaths.

title: Corinne Laframboise: Athlete learns she's three months pregnant days before fighting for UFC contract
description: Corinne Laframboise finds out she's three months pregnant, six days before fighting for a UFC contract on Dana White's Contender Series.

title: 'It's not good' - Star quarterback Rodgers injured on Jets debut
description: New York Jets coach Robert Saleh says a scan "is probably going to confirm what we think" after Aaron Rodgers suffers a suspected Achilles injury on debut.

title: Pay growth catches up with price rises
description: Regular pay rose by 7.8% in May to July compared with the same period last year, official figures show.

title: Israel Supreme Court showdown over controversial judicial reform
description: For the first time ever, all 15 judges convene to consider blocking a new controversial law.

title: Gulf War 'human shield' hostages set to take legal action
description: Hostages who were used as "human shields" say they should never have been allowed to land in Kuwait.

title: 149,000 fans at Hampden - the history of England v Scotland in numbers
description: England v Scotland is the oldest fixture in football history with a wealth of stats - BBC Sport brings you some of the best.

description: The Ukraine war has put Russia's nervous neighbours on high alert, reports Europe editor Katya Adler.

title: BBC reporter zip wires between London skyscrapers
description: The charity event saw 850 people riding by zip line from the Leadenhall Building to the Gherkin.

title: Martha's rule: Mother to press health secretary on patient rights
description: Merope Mills, whose daughter's death was preventable, says she will meet Stephen Barclay this week.

title: Australia MP says male colleague used to breathe on her neck in parliament
description: Karen Andrews says the physical harassment and crude comments occurred inside parliament.

title: Morocco needs help from 'whomever will give it'
description: Desperate residents of a remote Moroccan village plead for outside help after the devastation of the quake.

title: Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam: Why it is worrying Egypt and Sudan
description: Ethiopia is using water from the Nile to fill its giant Renaissance dam.

title: Nuzo Onoh - the Queen of African horror who is terrified of ghosts
description: British-Nigerian horror writer Nuzo Ono tells the BBC that she sleeps with a "bright light on".

title: Venice to vote on €5 a day fee for tourists
description: The charge - which will apply to all visitors aged over 14 - is designed to tackle soaring tourism.
